channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024110446
item.description:
Report E-2024110446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WALCOTT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver stopped at the end of his shift and doing the post trip inspection he noticed a little liquid dripping down on the passenger drive tire at approximately 2000ct 11/8/24. The driver then call the company emergency response number and a team was dispatched to the scene. In the meantime the drive put down some absorbent towels on the tire to collect any material that would continue to drip. The team arrived on scene at 2399ct 11/8/2024 and began preparing to enter the trailer. The trailer need to be vented and they were able to make entry at 0200ct 11/9/24 they found that a 30gallon drum had a loose bung. The team tightened the bung and cleaned up the excess material and disposed of them in the appropriate manner. The clean up was complete at 0545ct 11/9/24.

item.title: Report E-2024110361
item.description:
Report E-2024110361

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) ounce release of product from two (2) three (3) gallon metal pail. Personnel advised they cleaned the release and generated one (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the 2 damaged pails and spent product and absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110373
item.description:
Report E-2024110373

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When wearhouse man was moving pallet to load the pallet broke allowing the drum to fall off pallet damaging the lid and ring breaking the seal resulting in approximately 5 gallons being released. This facility has an internal response team located on sight and the response was immediate. The containment and clean up began at 1000ct with absorbent and booms laid out to absorb and contain the material to the pavement. The clean up took about 30--45 min to complete. The material and absorbent were collected and disposed of properly. The area was completed around 1100ct.

item.title: Report E-2024110336
item.description:
Report E-2024110336

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: ALTOONA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of product released due to a forklift accident at the terminal. The spill release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned release and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
